ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I learned several new writing techniques and how to interpret different forms of writing such as the white paper
I really made strides as a writer during my time in this course. Feedback from Professor Klemann was always precise and easy to understand.
Concise writing, writing nonfiction
Nonfiction writing, both creative and not.

Professor Klemanns English 121 significantly improves the clarity and directness of student writing, making it more appropriate for a professional setting. It also provides students with a better understanding of the different types of professional writing, ranging from clinical white papers to more narrative writing styles.
Writing skills based around synthesis of messaging, brevity, clarity.
Intricacies of writing, different sectors of finance, basics of creative nonfiction
I learned how different businesses integrate writing, both creative and factual, into their operation.
How to write good creative nonfictions; how to write succinctly and persuasively

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: This course was amazing, one of my favourite I've taken at yale

I believe there were many strengths to this course! First, Professor Klemann is awesome. She makes class extremely engaging and provides a fun atmosphere to learn. Second, the guest speakers were all so interesting and adds a change to class throughout the semester. Third, all of her feedback was to the point and I believe that is the best way to improve your writing. No weaknesses!
Professor was biggest strength
The assignments are both manageable and varied in content, Heather provides excellent feedback, class discussion is always lively, and the guest speakers were a great addition.

Professor Klemann is the greatest strength of this course. Her innovative curriculum gives students access to her wealth of personal experiences, and provides students with mentorship from her vast professional network. Her inspiring guest speakers serve as role models to her students, providing them with exposure to other industries and experiences, which is so much greater than any one person could provide on their own.
The course was titled writing about finance, but in reality there was near to no financial focus on finance with the exception of the guest speaker interviews.

Strengths: Really interesting guest speakers, amazing feedback on your writing, a variety of fun writing assignments
Weaknesses: None that I could think of!

The course was very engaging and time spent in the seminar always flew by. As far as weaknesses go, I wasnt always able to tell how each week of the semester built upon each other; the different units didnt tie together as much as I would have liked.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes!
Yes absolutely!
Yes! This was the best writing class I have taken at Yale!
Yes, the professor made all the difference. Excellent teaching.
Absolutely, even if not interested in finance. This is a great route to work on your nonfiction writing.

Absolutely! The course would be incredibly useful, not only for students considering a career in finance or in writing about business, but to any student who is looking to develop a clearer, more direct, more compelling writing style.
Absolutely
Yes- interesting and diverse course content and always very good, thoughtful feedback from Professor when assignments are graded.

I definitely would recommend! If you're looking for a writing credit and are interested in the finance space, this is a great class. You'll learn a lot and, if you put in effort for the different assignments, it's not super challenging to do well. Also, take this class for Prof. Klemann!! She's one of the best professors I've had at Yale, and she will definitely make you a better writer.
I would recommend this to any student who wishes to improve their writing and understand the real-world applications of writing!
